messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 50 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Extensions of the Cylindrical Algebraic Covering Method for Quantifiers

Paper Abstract: Abstract. The cylindrical algebraic covering method was originally proposed to decide the satisfiability of a set of non-linear real arithmetic constraints. We reformulate and extend the cylindrical algebraic covering method to allow for checking the truth of arbitrary non-linear arithmetic formulas, adding support for both quantifiers and Boolean structure. Furthermore, we also propose a variant to perform quantifier elimination on such formulas. After introducing the algorithm, we elaborate on various extensions, optimizations and heuristics. Finally, we present an experimental evaluation of our implementation and provide a comparison with state-of-the-art SMT solvers and quantifier elimination tools.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 50 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 50"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "CoCoALib: A C++ Library for Doing Computations in Commutative Algebra",
        "Proving UNSAT in SMT: The Case of Quantifier Free Non-Linear Real Arithmetic",
        "Deciding the Consistency of Non-Linear Real Arithmetic Constraints with a Conflict Driven Search Using Cylindrical Algebraic Coverings",
        "New Opportunities for the Formal Proof of Computational Real Geometry?",
        "Embedding the Virtual Substitution Method in the Model Constructing Satisfiability Calculus Framework (Work-in-progress Paper)",
        "Exploiting Strict Constraints in the Cylindrical Algebraic Covering",
        "The SMT-LIB Standard: Version 2.6",
        "Optimization Modulo Non-linear Arithmetic via Incremental Linearization",
        "Playing with Quantified Satisfaction",
        "QSMA: A New Algorithm for Quantified Satisfiability Modulo Theory and Assignment",
        "Companion to the Tutorial “Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition”, Presented at ISSAC ’04",
        "Guaranteed Solution Formula Construction",
        "Improved Projection for Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition",
        "Open Non-uniform Cylindrical Algebraic Decompositions",
        "QEPCAD B: A Program for Computing with Semi-Algebraic Sets Using CADs",
        "Solution Formula Construction for Truth Invariant CAD’s",
        "The Complexity of Quantifier Elimination and Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition",
        "Constructing a Single Cell in Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition",
        "From Simplification to a Partial Theory Solver for Non-Linear Real Polynomial Constraints",
        "Quantifier Elimination for Real Closed Fields by Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition",
        "SMT-RAT: An Open Source C++ Toolbox for Strategic and Parallel SMT Solving",
        "Efficient E-Matching for SMT Solvers",
        "A Model-Constructing Satisfiability Calculus",
        "Efficient Projection Orders for CAD",
        "The Complexity of Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition with Respect to Polynomial Degree",
        "DPLL(T): Fast Decision Procedures",
        "Complete Instantiation for Quantified Formulas in Satisfiabiliby Modulo Theories",
        "Using Machine Learning to Decide When to Precondition Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition with Groebner Bases",
        "An Effective Implementation of a Symbolic-Numeric Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition for Quantifier Elimination",
        "Solving Non-linear Arithmetic",
        "LibPoly: A Library for Reasoning about Polynomials",
        "Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition for Nonlinear Arithmetic Problems",
        "On the Implementation of Cylindrical Algebraic Coverings for Satisfiability Modulo Theories Solving",
        "Cylindrical Algebraic Coverings for Quantifiers",
        "Cooperating Techniques for Solving Nonlinear Real Arithmetic in the Cvc5 SMT Solver (System Description)",
        "An Improved Projection for Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition",
        "An Improved Projection Operation for Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition",
        "Validity Proof of Lazard’s Method for CAD Construction",
        "Algorithmic Algebra",
        "Subtropical Satisfiability for SMT Solving",
        "Levelwise Construction of a Single Cylindrical Algebraic Cell",
        "On Variable Orderings in MCSAT for Non-Linear Real Arithmetic",
        "Syntax-Guided Quantifier Instantiation",
        "Explainable AI Insights for Symbolic Computation: A Case Study on Selecting the Variable Ordering for Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition",
        "A Generic Projection Operator for Partial Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition",
        "Solving Systems of Strict Polynomial Inequalities",
        "A Decision Method For Elementary Algebra And Geometry",
        "Polynomial Constraints and Unsat Cores in Tarski",
        "Real Geometry and Connectedness via Triangular Description: CAD Example Bank",
        "Speeding Up Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition by Gröbner Bases"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 50 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Extensions of the Cylindrical Algebraic Covering Method for Quantifiers, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
